subject: Psychology
title: Functionalism
description: A short lesson to help you apply Functionalism.

hook.text: William James didn't care what consciousness is made of. He asked: what is it for? What does it do?

buildup.text: Functionalism, inspired by Darwin, studied the purpose of mental processes â€” how they help organisms adapt.

discovery.text: James argued consciousness is a stream, not a structure. It flows and adapts to serve survival needs.

twist.text: Functionalism broadened psychology beyond the lab. It opened the door to studying children, animals, and education.

climax.text: By asking 'what is it for?' instead of 'what is it?' functionalism made psychology practical and applicable.

punchline.text: Don't ask what the mind is. Ask what the mind does.

quiz.question: What question did functionalism focus on?
options: What is the purpose of mental processes
What are the basic elements of consciousness
How do neurons fire in the brain
